translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا خبر حادثه هولناکی که [همه انسان ها را از هر سو] فرا می گیرد، به تو رسیده است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا داستان غاشيه به تو رسيده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا خبر آن بلاى فراگير به تو رسيده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا خبر «غاشيه» به تو رسيده است؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول ما) آیا خبر هولناک قیامت و بلیّه عالم گیر محشر بر تو حکایت شده است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا خبر حادثه‌ی فراگیر (روز قیامت که مردمان بی‌دین و گناهکار را در بر می‌گیرد) به تو رسیده است؟ [[«هَلْ أَتَاکَ؟»: استفهام، برای نشان دادن عظمت شدائد و اهوال روز قیامت است. «الْغَاشِیَةِ»: فراگیرنده. مراد روز قیامت است که مردمان کافر و فاجر و فاسق را زیر مصائب و شدائد خود می‌گیرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا داستان هنگامه فراگیر به تو رسیده است؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا داستان غاشیه [= روز قیامت که حوادث وحشتناکش همه را می‌پوشاند] به تو رسیده است؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا بیامدت داستان فراگیرنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا خبر آن پوشنده فراگير- يعنى رستاخيز- به تو رسيده است؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا تو را داستان (حادثه‌ی فراگیر) بس پوشنده(ی چهره‌ها) رسیده است‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: HAS NEWS OF the Overpowering Event reached you?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Certainly the news of the calamity that will overwhelm has come to you!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Hast thou received the story of the Enveloper?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hath there come Unto thee the story of the Enveloping Event?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming (i.e. the Day of Resurrection);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Has there come to you the news of the overwhelming?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Has the news of the overwhelming event reached you?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Has there come to you the narration of Al-Ghashiyah (the overwhelming)

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hath there come unto thee tidings of the Overwhelming?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did you receive the account of the Enveloper?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have you received the news of the Enveloper?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have you heard the story of the overwhelming event (the Day of Judgment)?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Has not there come to you the news of the overwhelming calamity?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hal ataka hadeethu alghashiyati

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have you heard about the Overwhelming Event?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Has the story reached thee of the overwhelming (Event)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آن روز چهره هایی زبون و شرمسارند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آن روز وحشت در چهره‌ها پديدار است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چهره‌هايى در آن روز ذلت بارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در آن روز، چهره‌هايى زبونند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که آن روز رخسار گروهی (کافر و متکبر) ترسناک و ذلیل باشد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مردمانی، در آن روز خوار و زبون خواهند بود. [[«وُجُوهٌ»: چهره‌ها. مراد خود اشخاص و افراد است. «خَاشِعَةٌ»: خوار و زبون. فرو شکسته و درهم شکسته. خضوع ایشان، سرافکندگی آمیخته با شرمندگی و نگرانی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در چنین روز چهره‌هایی خاکسار باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چهره‌هایی در آن روز خاشع و ذلّت‌بارند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: رویهائی است در آن روز سرافکنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: رويهايى در آن روز فروشكسته‌اند- ترسناك و خوارند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در چنان روزی، چهره‌هایی زبونند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Many faces will be contrite on that day,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Many a face will be disgraced on that day.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Faces on that day humbled,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Faces on that Day shall be downcast,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated (in the Hell-fire, i.e. the faces of all disbelievers, Jews and Christians, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Faces on that Day will be shamed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Some faces that Day shall be downcast with fear,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Some faces that Day will be Khashi`ah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On that day (many) faces will be downcast,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Some faces on that day will be humbled,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day faces shall be humbled,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On that day the faces of some people will be humbly cast down,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (Some) faces on that day shall be downcast,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wujoohun yawmaithin khashiAAatun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day, there shall be downcast faces,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [آنان که همواره در دنیا] کوشیده اند و خسته شده اند [و سرانجام سودی نیافته اند]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تلاش كرده و رنج ديده،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: عمل [بيهوده‌] كرده و رنج [آخرت‌] برده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه تلاش كرده، رنج [بيهوده‌] برده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همه کارشان رنج و مشقّت است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دائماً خواهند کوشید و رنج خواهند کشید. [[«عَامِلَةٌ»: کوشا و پویا. مراد این است که همیشه این پا و آن پا می‌کنند و برمی‌جهند و می‌افتند، و آسایش و آرامش از آنان سلب‌می‌گردد، و هر دم گرفتار عذابی می‌شوند (نگا: غافر / 71 و 72، قمر / 47 و 48، رحمن / 44). «نَاصِبَةٌ»: در رنج. دچار زحمت و مشقّت. خسته و مانده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سختی دیده و محنت کشیده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها که پیوسته عمل کرده و خسته شده‌اند (و نتیجه‌ای عایدشان نشده است)،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: کارکننده‌اند رنجبرنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كوشنده‌اند- در اين جهان- و رنج كشنده- در آن جهان-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تلاش‌کننده‌ی رنج‌برنده‌اند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Labouring, wearied out,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Labouring, striving hard.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: labouring, toilworn,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Travailing, worn.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Labouring (hard in the worldly life by worshipping others besides Allah), weary (in the Hereafter with humility and disgrace).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Laboring and exhausted.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: be toiling and worn-out;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Laboring, weary.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Toiling, weary,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: wrought-up and weary:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: laboring, wornout,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Working [hard] and exhausted.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: troubled and tired as a result of their deeds in the past.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Laboring, toiling,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAamilatun nasibatun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: labouring, weary,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Labouring (hard), weary,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آتشی سوزان درآیند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آتش سوزان در افتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [ناچار] به آتشى سوزان در آيند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [ناچار] در آتشى سوزان درآيند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به آتش فروزان دوزخ در آیند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به آتش بس سوزان و گدازان دوزخ در خواهند آمد و خواهند سوخت. [[«تَصْلی»: به‌آتش داخل می‌شوند و بدان می‌سوزند (نگا: انشقاق 12، اعلی / 12). «حَامِیَةً»: بی‌نهایت گرم و سوزان (نگا: قاسمی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که به آتشی بس سوزان درآیند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آتش سوزان وارد می‌گردند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چشند آتشی سوزان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آتشى سخت سوزنده در آيند- يا به آتشى سخت سوزنده بسوزند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آتشی بس سوزان را شعله زنند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Burning in the scorching fire,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: (Yet) Going into the blazing fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: roasting at a scorching fire,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They shall roast into the scalding Fire,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will enter in the hot blazing Fire,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Roasting in a scorching Fire.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they shall burn in a Scorching Fire;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will enter into Fire, Hamiyah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Scorched by burning fire,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: they will enter a scorching fire

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: roasting at a scorching Fire

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will suffer the heat of the blazing fire

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Entering into burning fire,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tasla naran hamiyatan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: they shall enter a burning Fire

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The while they enter the Blazing Fire,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان را از چشمه ای بسیار داغ می نوشانند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از آن چشمه بسيار گرم آبشان دهند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: از چشمه‌اى داغ نوشانده شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: از چشمه‌اى داغ نوشانيده شوند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: از چشمه آب گرم جهنم آبشان نوشانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از چشمه‌ی بسیار داغ و گرمی نوشانده خواهند شد. [[«عَیْنٍ»: چشمه. «آنِیَةٍ»: بسیار داغ و گرم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از چشمه‌ای گرم به آنان نوشانده شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از چشمه‌ای بسیار داغ به آنان می‌نوشانند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نوشانیده شوند از چشمه جوشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از چشمه‌اى بسيار گرم آبشان دهند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: از چشمه‌ای داغ (و) جوشان لبریز، نوشانیده شوند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Given water from the boiling spring to drink.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Made to drink water from the boiling hot spring.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: watered at a boiling fountain,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Given to drink of a spring fiercely boiling.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will be given to drink from a boiling spring,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Given to drink from a flaming spring.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: their drink shall be from a boiling spring.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will be given to drink from a boiling (Aniyah) spring,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Drinking from a boiling spring,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and made to drink from a boiling spring.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: that is fueled from a tremendously hot fountain,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and will be made to drink from a fiercely boiling spring.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Made to drink from a boiling spring.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tusqa min AAaynin aniyatin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and will be made to drink from a boiling spring,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The while they are given, to drink, of a boiling hot spring,

verses.text: لَيْسَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ طَعَامٌ‌ إِلاَّ مِنْ‌ ضَرِيعٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برای آنان طعامی جز خار خشک و زهرآگین وجود ندارد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: طعامى جز خار ندارند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: طعامى جز از خار تلخ ندارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خوراكى جز خار خشك ندارند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: طعامی غیر ضریع دوزخ (که علفی بد طعم و بوست) غذای آنها نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان خوراکی جز ضریع نخواهند داشت. [[«ضَرِیعٍ»: گیاه‌خارداری که شبرق نامیده می‌شود. خشکیده آن را ضَریع می‌گویند. گویا ناگوارترین و تهوّع‌آورترین گیاه است و هیچ حیوانی آن را نمی‌چرد، جز شتر که تا تَر است آن را می‌خورد و چون خشکید از آن کناره‌گیری می‌کند. اگر در جاهائی طعام دوزخیان منحصر به زقّوم (نگا: صافّات / 62، دخان / 43، واقعه / 52) و در موردی محدود به غِسْلین (نگا: حاقّه / 36) شده است، بدان خاطر است که دوزخیان مختلفند و عذاب هم دارای انواع و اقسام است، و هر یک از آنها برای گروهی از ایشان است. یا این که این الفاظ، تعبیرها و تمثیلهائی از غذای دوزخیان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: خوراکی غیر از خار خشک زهردار ندارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: غذائی جز از ضَریع [= خار خشک تلخ و بدبو] ندارند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیستشان خوراکی جز از خار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنها را هيچ خوردنى نيست مگر خار درشت تلخ- كه هيچ چارپايى نمى‌خورد-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: خوراکی جز آنچه به تضرعشان آوَرَد ندارند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will have no food except bitter thorn,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: There is no food for them except thorns of fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: no food for them but cactus thorn

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: No food shall be theirs save bitter thorn,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: No food will there be for them but a poisonous thorny plant,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will have no food except thorns.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They shall have no food except bitter dry thorns

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: No food will there be for them but from Dari`,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: No food for them save bitter thorn-fruit

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will have no food except cactus,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: no food for them except thorny plants

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will have no food other than bitter and thorny fruit

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall have no food but of thorns,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laysa lahum taAAamun illa min dareeAAin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: they shall have no food but thorns,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari'

verses.text: لاَ يُسْمِنُ‌ وَ لاَ يُغْنِي‌ مِنْ‌ جُوعٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که نه فربه می کند و نه از گرسنگی بی نیاز می نماید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه نه فربه مى‌كند و نه دفع گرسنگى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه نه فربه كند و نه گرسنگى زدايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand

translations.text: پس تذكر ده كه تو تنها تذكردهنده‌اى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس خلق را (به حکمتهای الهی) متذکر ساز که وظیفه پیغمبری تو غیر از این نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو پند و اندرز بده و (مردمان را به وظائفشان) یادآوری کن. چرا که تو تنها پند دهنده و یادآوری کننده‌ای و بس. [[«ذَکِّرْ»: پند بده. یادآوری کن. «مُذَکِّرٌ»: پند دهنده. یادآوری کننده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس اندرز ده که همانا تو اندرزگویی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس تذکّر ده که تو فقط تذکّر دهنده‌ای!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس یادآوری کن جز این نیست توئی یادآورنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس يادآورى كن و پند ده كه تو يادآور و پنددهنده‌اى و بس.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس یادآور باش که تو، تنها، یادآورنده‌ای (و)

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Remind them; you are surely a reminder.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore advise; indeed you are a proclaimer of advice. (The Holy Prophet is a Remembrance from Allah.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then remind them! Thou art only a reminder;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Admonish thou then; thou art but an admonisher.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So remind them (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)), you are only a one who reminds.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So remind. You are only a reminder.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So render good counsel, for you are simply required to counsel,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So remind them -- you are only one who reminds.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Remind them, for thou art but a remembrancer,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So admonish—for you are only an admonisher,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore remind, you are only a Reminder.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), preach; you are only a preacher.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore do remind, for you are only a reminder.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fathakkir innama anta muthakkirun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So, [O Prophet] exhort them: your task is only to exhort,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore do thou give admonition, for thou art one to admonish.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تو بر آنان مسلط نیستی [که به قبول ایمان مجبورشان کنی،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تو بر آنان فرمانروا نيستى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تو بر كفار گماشته و مراقب نيستى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بر آنان تسلّطى ندارى،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو مسلط و توانا بر (تبدیل کفر و ایمان) آنها نیستی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو بر آنان چیره و مسلّط نیستی (تا ایشان را به ایمان واداری). [[«مُصَیْطِرٍ»: مسلّط. چیره (نگا: بقره / 256، یونس / 99، ق / 45). این واژه را با (س) و (ص) خوانده‌اند. تبدیل سین به صاد به علّت مناسبت با (ط) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و] بر آنان مسلط [و حکمفرما] نیستی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تو سلطه‌گر بر آنان نیستی که (بر ایمان) مجبورشان کنی،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیستی بر ایشان فرمانده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بر آنان گماشته و چيره نيستى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بر آنان تسلّطی نداری.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You are not a warden over them,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: You are not at all a guardian over them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: thou art not charged to oversee them.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thou art not over them a warden.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You are not a dictator over them.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You have no control over them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and are not invested with the authority to compel them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: You are not a Musaytir over them.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou art not at all a warder over them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and not a taskmaster over them—

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You are not charged to oversee them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You are not over them a controller.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You do not have full control over them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: You are not a watcher over them;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lasta AAalayhim bimusaytirin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you are not their keeper.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thou art not one to manage (men's) affairs.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ولی کسی که [به دنبال تذکر پی در پی] روی گردانید و کفر ورزید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آن كس كه رويگردان شد و كفر ورزيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر آنكس كه پشت كند و كافر شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر كسى كه روى بگرداند و كفر ورزد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جز آنکه هر کس (پس از تذکر) روی از حق بگرداند و کافر شود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا کسی که (از حق و حقیقت روی بگرداند و به آئین الهی) پشت کند و کفر ورزد. [[«إِلاّ»: لیکن. امّا. استثناء منقطع است (نگا: نساء / 80، انعام / 107، شوری / 48). برخی استثناء را متّصل می‌دانند و مستثنی‌منه را مفعول محذوف فعل (فَذَکِّرْ) می‌شمارند. در این صورت معنی چنین است: ای پیغمبر! همه‌کس را اندرز بده، مگر آنان که می‌روند و روی می‌گردانند و به ایمان و قرآن پشت می‌کنند (نگا: زخرف / 83).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر کسی که روی برتابد و کفر پیشه کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر کسی که پشت کند و کافر شود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر آنکه روی برتافت و کفر ورزید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن كس را كه پشت كرد و كفر ورزيد- كه او را سود نكند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر کسی که روی گردانید و کفر ورزید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than him who turns his back and denies,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except whoever turns away and disbelieves –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But he who turns his back, and disbelieves,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But whosoever will turn back and disbelieve -

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Save the one who turns away and disbelieves

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But whoever turns away and disbelieves.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But whoever will turn away (from the Truth),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Save the one who turns away and disbelieves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But whoso is averse and disbelieveth,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except him who turns back and disbelieves.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for those who turn their back and disbelieve,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: However, he who turns away and disbelieves -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: However, those who turn away and disbelieve,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But whoever turns back and disbelieves,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa man tawalla wakafara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But whoever turns back and denies the truth,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But if any turn away and reject Allah,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس خدا او را به عذاب بزرگ تر عذاب خواهد کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس خدايش به عذاب بزرگ‌تر عذاب مى‌كند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس خدا او را به عذاب بزرگتر، عذاب مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه خدا او را به آن عذاب بزرگتر عذاب كند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: او را خدا به عذابی بزرگ (در دوزخ) معذب کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند بزرگترین عذاب را بدو می‌رساند (که عذاب اخروی است). [[«الْعَذَابَ الأکْبَرَ»: بزرگترین عذاب. مراد عذاب آخرت است که در مقابل آن عذاب دنیا است که کمترین عذاب نامیده می‌شود (نگا: سجده / 21).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که خداوند او را به عذابی سهمگین، عذاب کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که خداوند او را به عذاب بزرگ مجازات می‌کند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که عذاب کندش خدا آن عذاب بزرگتر

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس خدا او را عذاب كند بزرگترين عذاب.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس خدا او را به بزرگ‌ترین عذاب تعذیب کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In which case he will be punished by God with the severest punishment.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So Allah will mete out to him the greatest punishment.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: God shall chastise him with the greatest chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Him Allah shall torment with the greatest torment.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God will punish him with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah will chastise him with the most terrible chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Allah will punish him with direst punishment.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Him Allah will punish with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah will punish them with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God will punish them with the greatest torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Allah will chastise him with the greatest chastisement.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FayuAAaththibuhu Allahu alAAathaba alakbara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: will be punished by God with the greatest punishment.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Allah will punish him with a mighty Punishment,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قطعاً بازگشت آنان به سوی ماست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه بازگشتشان به سوى ماست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا بازگشتشان به سوى ماست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، بازگشت آنان به سوى ماست،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته باز گشت آنها به سوی ماست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مسلّماً بازگشت آنان (پس از مرگ و رستاخیز) به سوی ما خواهد بود. [[«إِیَاب»: بازگشتن. برگشتن. رجوع.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان بازگشت آنان به نزد ماست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین بازگشت (همه) آنان به سوی ماست،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا بسوی ماست بازگشتشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا بازگشتشان به سوى ماست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان بازگشت آنان تنها سوی ماست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To Us is surely their returning;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed only towards Us is their return

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Truly, to Us is their return;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily Unto us is their reckoning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, to Us will be their return;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To Us is their return.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely to Us is their return;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, to Us will be their return;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! unto Us is their return

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed to Us will be their return.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, to Us they shall return,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, to Us is their return.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: To Us they will all return.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely to Us is their turning back,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna ilayn<u>a</u> iy<u>a</u>bahum

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Certainly, it is to Us that they will return.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For to Us will be their return;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه بی تردید حسابشان بر عهده ماست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس حسابشان با ماست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن‌گاه حسابشان با ماست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه حساب [خواستن از] آنان به عهده ماست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه حسابشان بر ما خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن گاه حساب (و کتاب و سروکار) ایشان با ما خواهد بود. [[«ثُمَّ»: پس از آن. «عَلَیْنَا حِسَابَهُمْ»: حساب ایشان با ما است و ما خودمان می‌دانیم که با آنان چه کار می‌کنیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس حساب آنان با ماست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و مسلّماً حسابشان (نیز) با ماست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس همانا بر ماست حسابشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه حسابشان بر ماست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس حسابشان بی‌امان تنها بر ماست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Ours is surely then to reckon with them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then indeed only upon Us is their reckoning.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then upon Us shall rest their reckoning.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then verily on us is their reckoning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then upon Us rests their reckoning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then it is for Us to call them to account.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Ours their reckoning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then, indeed, their reckoning will lie with Us.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then upon Us shall rest their reckoning.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In Our hands are their accounts.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then surely upon Us is the taking of their account.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma inna AAalayn<u>a</u> <u>h</u>is<u>a</u>bahum

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then, surely, it is for Us to call them to account.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.
